title: Chinese Broccoli Recipe
description: Chinese broccoli (gai lan) is cooked until tender, then tossed with a sweet and savory sauce flavored with ginger, hoisin, rice vinegar, garlic, and sesame.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Vegetables Broccoli Chinese Broccoli 4.3 (73) 56 Reviews 11 Photos Chinese broccoli is my favorite veggie. This recipe combines this wonderful creation with Asian flavors for a delicious side. Submitted by Somer Updated on March 10, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 11 11 11 11 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 bunch gai lan (Chinese broccoli), trimmed 3 tablespoons hoisin sauce 2 tablespoons white sugar 2 tablespoons soy sauce 1 tablespoon cornstarch 1 tablespoon rice vinegar 1 tablespoon sesame oil 2 cloves garlic, minced 1 teaspoon minced fresh ginger root or to taste Directions Gather all ingredients. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Addelyn Evans / Prop Stylist: Gabriel Greco Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook Chinese broccoli in boiling water, uncovered, until just tender, about 4 minutes. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Addelyn Evans / Prop Stylist: Gabriel Greco Drain and place in a shallow bowl. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Addelyn Evans / Prop Stylist: Gabriel Greco Whisk together hoisin sauce, sugar, soy sauce, cornstarch, rice vinegar, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger in a small saucepan over medium heat until sauce is thickened and no longer cloudy, 5 to 7 minutes. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Addelyn Evans / Prop Stylist: Gabriel Greco Pour sauce over broccoli; toss to coat and serve. Brie Goldman / Food Stylist: Addelyn Evans / Prop Stylist: Gabriel Greco I Made It Print 126 home cooks made it! Found this and had all the ingredients except the Gai Lan so I used regular broccoli instead. It was really, really good! Would like to try again with the intended vegetable. Glad I found and this is a keeper. Thanks Somer! 03 of 11 Photo by  France C 09/10/2023 I had never prepared Chinese broccoli before. I'm glad I tried it! This recipe tastes like something you'd get in a restaurant. I was able to find Chinese broccoli at my local Asian supermarket (H-Mart). Cook time was spot-on. The sauce was very flavorful.
